Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2008 08:40PM lizzy68 wrote: LunaMoon please talk to someone. Your to young to do this all alone.... Please talk to an Aunt or a close family friend. I'm 40 just diagnosed and to young to do this alone!!!!! I'm sure you have at least 1 person your close to, it don't have to be a female. Please let us know what happens as I have young daughters and am truly worried about you... place your arms around yourself and and squeeze..... There you have just been hugged by lizzy68
Posts.Title: Teenager worried o.o LunaMoon barbe1958

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2009 06:57AM lizzy68 wrote: Hi Jancie sorry you had to join our sisterhood but you've found the most supportive group of women and men!!! I'm also new to the sisterhood... 12-26-08 I had a lumpectomy done 12-23-08  and both lumps were positive. I have to have my lymph nodes checked on 1-8-09 so believe me I know about rollercoaster....   These boards have so much info. so just ask and you will get answers...   Have a great day and come back here often it will help...
Posts.Title: I am scared -just diagnosed jancie traceyz

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2008 02:16AM lizzy68 wrote: I just had 2 lumps and tissue removed on 12-23 and got the results back on 12-26. I was told I have 2 types of cancer. OMG is all I keep thinking.... I didn't feel my lumps or anything my OB didn't either. I had my 1st mammogram and then ultrasound I was VERY happy my Dr. removed both lumps instead of  just taking a piece... He used the words SUSPICIOUS so I knew... Now I find out what type and all on 12-31-08  Finding out early is so important, do you feel comfortable waiting??? I know I didn't and there is NO cancer in my family!!! I'm the first... So you have to do what your comfortable with... Please keep us posted. Lizzy
